intro: Raphanus ibericus, commonly known as the Iberian radish, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and borne in racemes, while the root is usually small and mildly peppery. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
